page.title: 13Laughton-Peoples' Views
page.content: Last week Nicola and I went out surveying our village. We asked questions about peoples' lives in Laughton. The things that we were trying to find out was about their lives in the village, the things they liked and what they disliked about living here. Everyone we talked to was married and over 21. We also found two widows. Nearly everyone said that the area is quiet, and that was the best thing they liked. Sometimes though, they thought that Saturday nights were a bit noisy when the public houses turned out. Then we asked them whether they thought of themselves as newcomers to the village. All of them said "No", except one person. The one that thought she was a newcomer said that she was accepted in the village, but we found out that she had lived here 10 years.
